name: Dial Before You Dig (DBYD) and Permit to Excavate completed and signed onto by personnel - HOLD POINT REQUIRED
Confirmation of DBYD uploaded to CONQA and acknowledged by RCC PM and Supervisor
Confirmation of Scope and Extent of Works with Project Team, including RCC and TSC
Details any Variations below and confirm if these have been uploaded to Assigner:
Confirmation of any variations to scope of work
Traffic Control – TGS approved and appropriately selected for the works
Minor clearing of vegetation undertaken – where applicable.
Demolition works / Spoil Removal undertaken and spoil removed from site to Quirks Quarry - HOLD POINT REQUIRED
Is subgrade or sub base suitable
HOLD POINT: If unsuitable is encountered TSC to be notified prior to works continuing
Table drains shaped to allow water to flow freely and best marry into existing surfaces.
Proof roll subgrade: If foundation fails TSC to be notified and to site instruction required - HOLD POINT REQUIRED
Road base Material: Material source along with conforming material NATA test certificates have been submitted and approved by the Principal (Material Stockpile Lot)

If testing required - Layers compacted to 100% Standard compaction for full formation width. Compaction testing to be done 1 test per 500m2, minimum of 3 test taken at a time (per lot) or as directed otherwise.
Levels of gravel marry into existing and deviation does not exceed 12mm over the length of a 3m straight edge.
HOLD POINT – Carry out a proof roll of finished pavement where applicable
Geotextile – A34 Geotextile separator placed prior to rock placement IF DIRECTED or WITHIN SCOPE
Rock Placement - Rock to be placed in completed drain profile as per agreed scope. Correct Rock Size Placed
Existing rock to be grouted as per agreed scope
Rocks to be cleaned down at end of grouting for neat finish
Excavation & Preparation - Suitable subgrade material and prepared to suitable surface

Formwork & Reinforcement - Dimensions and positions of forms shall be carefully checked after the forms are erected. Forms shall be aligned accurately and the location of all fittings, hold formers etc. checked prior to placing of concrete.

Formwork & Reinforcement - Placing of reinforcement as per agreed scope, with reference to Typical Construction Details. Reinforcement to maintain a 50mm vertical and horizontal cover unless directed otherwise.

HOLD POINT – PRE-POUR INSPECTION The formwork shall be inspected by the Superintendent, and the placing of reinforcement in the spaces formed, where specified, shall not commence until the formwork is approved by the Superintendent.
Ready Mix Concrete - The concrete shall be mixed and delivered in accordance with the requirements of AS 1379 - PLEASE ATTACH OR TAKE PHOTOS OF LAST DOCKETS FROM EACH POUR
Concrete Placement - Concrete finished to TSC Standard
Two pairs of test specimens shall be moulded for each 15 cubic metres of concrete, or part thereof, one pair being intended for the 7-day test if required and the other pair for a 28-day test.
WITNESS POINT: Concrete test specimens to be taken in presence of Superintendent or Superintendent’s representative
Stormwater components installed as per scope of works - HOLD POINT REQUIRED
Size & quantity of pipe & pits installed
HOLD POINT: Inspection prior to backfill
Density testing of pipeline required if within roadway:- 100% compaction to be achieved
Site left tidy & DM spray mark removed
Site Handover: All works complete, demobilised and site handed back to TSC
Verify conformance including close out of NCR’s
Damage No. (DM) signed off and closed by PM or representative
Are Earthworks completed to Finished Level?
Has the Client been advised of start date?
Existing services located and clearly marked (attach DBYD if applicable)
All materials delivered to site have been inspected thoroughly and: a) Are free of damage/cracks b) Pipe class, type and size matches plans. (upload images of damaged materials here)
HOLD POINT - Clients representative to acknowledge materials have been inspected and are free of damage/cracks.
Pits excavated to depth and checked with laser (allowed for 100mm bedding)
Pits exceeding 1.5m are correctly battered or compliant shoring installed
Pits Installed at correct height and orientation
Trenches excavated to depth and checked with grade laser (allowed for 100mm bedding)
Trenches exceeding 1.5m are correctly battered or compliant shoring installed
HOLD POINT - Presence of groundwater or contaminated material authorisation to proceed Requested & Approved (If Applicable)
Trench bedding material installed as per specification
Pipe laid to grade (as per drawings) ensuring socket faces upstream and is free of foreign materials prior to installation of adjoining pipe
Each joint visually inspected (rubber rings, witness marks, etc) and lifting holes plugged
HOLD POINT - Clients representative to acknowledge compliant Pipe/Pit Installation
Suitable material backfilled in layers not exceeding 150mm compacted thickness
HOLD POINT - Clients representative to acknowledge Bedding, Haunching & backfill compliance
Compaction testing Completed and Complies (attach compaction test results)
CCTV Carried out upon completion of works (If applicable)
